definitions.text: an accumulation caused by clogging or a stoppage
examples: a traffic backup on the main street
he discovered a backup in the toilet

definitions.text: someone who takes the place of another (as when things get dangerous or difficult)
examples: the star had a stand-in for dangerous scenes
we need extra employees for summer fill-ins

definitions.text: a musical part (vocal or instrumental) that supports or provides background for other musical parts
(computer science) a copy of a file or directory on a separate storage device
examples: he made a backup in case the original was accidentally damaged or erased

definitions.text: the act of providing approval and support
examples: his vigorous backing of the conservatives got him in trouble with progressives
